results.content: During course theres a lot of logical bugs and bad patterns presented. Trainer seems not to be prepared well. For example there are bugs with database schema and POST request route (section 3 chapter 12) code which is written make you unable to continue course. Also logical mistakes like wrong status code responses. There’s no implementation of OAuth 2.0 :( There’s also only example how to use GET, POST and DELETE requests… where’s PUT? In the last section - about REFACTORING - there’s a critical bug, controller method is wrong invoked - and author is saying that everything works fine… LOL. To be honest sometimes it was really difficult to understand what trainer is saying - and there’s also no subtitles (auto generated aren’t good enough). It was funny but sometimes there’s doubled content in videos - trainer are speaking exactly same sentences twice (probably editor mistakes) ;) Summarizing I’m happy I paid discounted price for this course. If you want to get solid information about RESTful api - please go somewhere else. Here are just the basics and in not good way of presentation. It’s a shame for such good publisher like packt is.

For example there are bugs with database schema and POST request route (section 3 chapter 12) code which is written make you unable to continue course. Also logical mistakes like wrong status code responses. There’s no implementation of OAuth 2.0 :( There’s also only example how to use GET, POST and DELETE requests… where’s PUT? In the last section - about REFACTORING - there’s a critical bug, controller method is wrong invoked - and author is saying that everything works fine… LOL. To be honest sometimes it was really difficult to understand what trainer is saying - and there’s also no subtitles (auto generated aren’t good enough). It was funny but sometimes there’s doubled content in videos - trainer are speaking exactly same sentences twice (probably editor mistakes) ;) Summarizing I’m happy I paid discounted price for this course. If you want to get solid information about RESTful api - please go somewhere else. Here are just the basics and in not good way of presentation. It’s a shame for such good publisher like packt is.
